fields_of_interest: Competition, Consumers, Single market, Digital economy and society, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives:
* The Next Generation Internet Initiative 
* The General Data Protection Regulation 
* The eIDAS Regulation 
* The Second Payment Services Directive 
* The Directive on Consumer Rights 
 
as well as generally activities concerning the "Digital Single Market"
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
OpenID Foundation (International Identity Standards Body) 
FDIH (The Danish E-commerce Association) 
IT-Pol (The Danish IT-Political Association) 
MyData Global Association (International NGO)
goals__remit:
The purpose of Peercraft is to create a basis for direct data driven commerce between commercial vendors and consumers - thus eliminating the need for "platforms" as overly costly intermediaries. 
 
This is pursued via participation in international standardization committes as well as cooperation with organizations with similar purposes as well as with public authorities.
relevant_communication:
Peercraft is supporting and promoting the "MyData" initiative as launched by the Finnish Ministry of Transportation, now under NGO incorporation as "MyData Global Association" 
 
We aim at the political and technological enablement of a more efficient combination of "Big Data" and "Privacy" 
 
We promote EU acceptance of relevant international standards in the area of Identity, Reputation, and Personal Data Management. 
 
We are part of the MAGPIE INITIATIVE consortium (http://magpieinitiative.eu/) applying for funding related to Cybersecurity, Privacy, Data Protection, Digital Identities. 
 
We have launched the Open Source project https://www.opendiscovery.biz/ to develop practical and attractive decentralized alternatives to the current platform dominated economy.
